The restrooms can be nasty and are shared with a couple of adjoining restaurants.

Went here with a group of friends and had a very pleasant experience. 

Wait staff was prompt and inviting. 

I had the steak and it was cooked to my specifications and the sides were very good.

Will definitely come back

In my opinion this is the best place to get a burger in the Champaign-Urbana area this place is amazing their onion rings are wonderful they use extremely high-quality ingredients high quality food the place is a busy place so you do have to wait but that's what is good food takes time that's why it's always busy it's where the locals go it's not some ridiculous chain restaurant thank you it has an amazing selection of drinks and it is also family-friendly if that's not your taste

So tasty! I had heard that they had the best burgers in town, so I went, me and my friends all got different burgers, and they did not disappoint. Fries are pretty standard, but burgers are fantastic.

I happen to go here every birthday per tradition and it's definitely something I look forward to every year. Their burgers are solid and my personal favorite was a daily special they happened to have - burger with bacon and Gouda mac&cheese. Fries are good too. The place is small and "homey" but they often generate long lines out the door, so go early if you can (before 6pm).

overrated. Maybe it was just the one day that I went. They were really busy that day. The portions are huge and it looked great but overall the burger was bland and the fries as well. Everyone in my table felt the same way and thought it was an underwhelming experience.

definitely a place for yummy burgers!

 don't need to get too complex or over think on the menu...order a burger.  trust me. any burger....well maybe except veggie burger (that is not really a burger right?).   the burgers are griddle cooked so they are juicy, but apparently, they don't bother varying the temperature when you order.  so all burgers came out grey in the middle which is not the end of the world.  its a yummy burger, good seasoning and massive (1/2lb patties "this is not a steak and shake thin patty"). the bun holds up really nicely to the size and greasy drip of fat....oh i want another one now man!

had the spicy habenero/jalapeno cheeseburger and fries, (which i thought was the best option amongst the add on sides).  portions are good enough to make sure you don't get hungry and have a little snack about 3hrs later when you start thinking about what to do for dinner. 

the house potato chips were great as well, just thick enough for some heartiness, but retains its crisp of a chip.  I detected some truffle flavor which I turn a nose on.  

the standard side of tortilla chips was pretty decent as well.  

we had a larger party of 10, which they were able to arrange us nicely combining a few tables.   it gets packed for lunch with a constant flow and queue but its well worth the wait.  

I counted only a couple servers but they were great and helpful.  The server asked us how we would want to split the check up before we even ordered - smart man.

I'd go back again, but only if I'm ready for downing another huge yummy burger with fries and washed down with a nice cold beer or a gigantic 32oz pepsi.

It's fine. That's the best I can say about it, and in my book, fine is a four-letter word. The end first; my bill for one so-so Bloody Mary, a burger and fries was just about $20 BEFORE tip...just for lunch. I got there right when they opened, at 11 and was seated right away. Ordered the cocktail that took close to 15 minutes to get, then ordered burger and that took another 25 minutes. I didn't get out of their until well after noon. By then the place was packed. Nothing special, the burger was, I think, pretty much the cheapest thing on the menu. The blue cheese sauce was good, but so runny, it fell off. The fries, while homemade, are fine. I doubt I'll return, unless someone else suggests it to meet there....and I eat out a lot. The atmosphere was par for a sports bar/burger joint....but, at their prices, it should be a fine eating establishment.

I really love the russell burger and the fries were so yummy and also my Fat tire beer  it seems so hidden but my friends said to try the burgers  
I'm glad I came . And the atmosphere was kinda laid back but pretty cool place too hang out and eat those delicious  burgers.  I will be coming back 
ALOT !!!!!!

Best burgers in town. 
Make sure to try the one with the blue cheese!!!

This is a great hole in the wall place.  It isn't the easiest to find if you haven't already been there.

They have a lot of good food and the service is very courteous.

I have been here several times and only had problems once (it was just waiting a while to get the check) which can happen when it gets busy.

Farren's is the prototypical hole-in-the-wall establishment. Out of the way of the regular downtown foot traffic, it's located in an alley. But every time I go there, it's packed to the door. 

The food is amazing. I love the green chile cheeseburger because it reminds me of home. Ask them to replace the pepper jack cheese with cheddar. Don't bother paying extra for a fancier side order to replace the tricolor chips - they're amazing. Ask for extra salsa!

The service is alright - sometimes you have to flag down a server, but the place is super busy, so it's understandable.

Not good for a quick bite. Not open late. Be prepared to wait. 

A party of two will be sat almost immediately at the bar. Any party bigger than that must wait.

Tried Farren's out for the first time last night and WOW.  I have been in CU for several years now and hadn't heard of this place until checking reviews on Yelp.  The burgers were a bit pricey but quality was very good.  The key lime pie is also a must-have.

I really enjoyed eating Pesto & Cheese Sandwich with Fries. Also we had Mozzarella Cheese sticks as our starter, which was tasty but lesser quantity than we had expected based on its price.

Overall, great experience for an American meal in Champaign. Quality of service was also great. Would go there to have a good sandwich / burger there again.

My go to place whenever I stop in Champaign.  Granted, it only has been 2 times in the last 6 years (for Badger away games) but both times I left impressed.  We stopped in last weekend after the game and found people already waiting to get a table.  Luckily, there were spots left at the bar to saddle up to.  The tap list itself is rather small (perhaps 4-5 choices) but Farren's shines in their bottle and can selection.  Foodwise, you can't go wrong with a burger.  Fresh ground meat, a great bun and cooked to perfection.  I opted for the Russell-mushrooms, bacon, pepperjack cheese and blue cheese sauce.  I was skeptical with mixing the two cheeses but I soon turned into a believer upon my first bite.  The burgers are huge and I couldn't imagine someone opting to add another patty to something this large (it is an option).  
Our bartender was great and quick to take our order and bring out food.  
No clue when I will be back to Champaign but when I do, I guarantee I will be back to Farren's
Probably the best burger in Champaign.. Not enough meat with one patty? Double it up and go all out. Small seating area but usually still don't have to wait in this tucked back treat.
Big burgers and handcut fries.....it was ok....seemed pricey....
Bacon Cheeseburger-yum!  Excellent bean burger for my lunch mate as well, terrific service!  Just don't expect fancy decor and you'll be good!

My favorite burger joint in Champaign. I got a burger with blue cheese sauce in it and it was RIDICULOUS! The atmosphere is not the greatest but I go to a restaurant to eat and if the food is this good I can deal with a lacking atmosphere.

My brother convinced me to eat downtown instead of going out for Indian. Since I love burgers, he suggested that we go to Farren's. I have heard a number of good things about Farren's so I agreed. I was so surprised when we walked up to the building. I like holes in the wall, but boy is this one. There was a short line when we came in. There was no host in sight, but one came after a few minutes and we were seated quickly after that. 

My brother ordered The Russell with toppings for The Fire Burger (jalapenos, red peppers, onions). I ordered The Spicoli without mushrooms and added the blue cheese topping. My brother mentioned that he heard that the chips with truffle sea salt were pretty good. We asked our waitress if we could get the truffle salt on the fries, as well, and she said yes. So that is what I ordered. The burger was very good, but needed more bacon. The truffle salt definitely made the fries better than the regular- I tasted my brother's regular fries. They were a tad bit overcooked. 

I do find the place to be a bit dirty. The floor just felt oily underneath my feet. The bathroom was ick. And worn. Advice: Eat quickly and get out.

Great great burgers. Kobe burger cooked to chefs liking was perfect. Came down from Chi for work and I'm lucky to have found this place. I've been here 3 days and had dinner there twice. I'll eat there the next 2 nights with confidence.

I think it goes without saying that this is my opinion but a burger from Farren's is the best burger available in CU, no contest.  Fries are nothing special  but if yr looking for tasty fries you prolly know where to go (Courier, Esquire, Wonderdogs).  I stick with the chips that come with the burger.

Friendly staff - sorry to hear the other young lady found it to be too friendly, but I would suggest it's better than the alternative.  I guarantee that it's meant to make sure you are happy with your meal - more like "when yr here, yr family" than olive garden could ever be.

The best burger around, period.  Nice selection of good salads too.

Best salads eva! Scallop salad is ahhhmazing and it's huge. There's a strawberry chicken salad that my friend always gets and it looks delish too. Both salads have fresh strawberries, a delicious dressing and these crunchy cracker things on the sides that are also very good. Everyone I know loves the burgers here, I haven't had one but the French fries are to die for. The place is pretty cold in the winter months so dress warm, summer the AC is running and it's chilly then too so bring a jacket. It's a very casual atmosphere.

This review is specifically for our last visit to Farren's. Not normally the type to review restaurants, but this particular experience was disappointing especially because I actually really enjoyed this place in the past. 

As mentioned, we've eaten here multiple times and have always thoroughly enjoyed it. We come for the burgers and they definitely satisfy that craving. The service in our previous visits has been great. Even when they are in the dinner rush, the servers we've had in the past were very attentive. I've been here as a party of two and as a party of eight, and both times, they did not disappoint.

I say all that to preface the disappointment of the most recent visit when we came in around 6 pm as the dinner rush was just starting. We were seated, got our waters, got our orders taken, and that was the end of our service. For 45 minutes we waited to get our food or at least some kind of update as to why there might be a delay. I realize 45 minutes isn't exactly forever, but it's definitely a long time for Farren's in my experience. Even when we came for dinner with a party of 8, I don't think we waited more than 30 minutes. And even then, the server we had was letting us know how much more time we could expect to wait and was making sure drinks  were taken care of.

We didn't get that this time. We got a server we've never had before, and we just noticed as he served and brought food to all the tables that came in after us. After the 45 minutes, we were convinced our order had been forgotten so we left. It just sucks because again, we were definitely fans of this place.

Farren's Pub & Eatery is has a casual type of atmosphere. It's a great place to go with your friends to enjoy good American style food and drinks. Their burgers here are so delicious and juicy! I'm almost getting hungry right now just thinking about it.

Service was great, very attentive even if they were swamped. Maybe it's my fault because I ordered a burger that was too spicy for me to handle, but I expected a lot better. Will definitely visit again and get something that is easier to enjoy.

Exceedingly mediocre experience. I've heard numerous rave reviews about this "hidden gem" but after eating here I'm truly puzzled. Am I in the right place?
 
Poor beer, wine and food selection (as in no selection). We tried the fried ravioli which were served on a bed of wilting lettuce. The mediocrity pushed us to ask if they were made in house-- our server told us no with an apologetic smile. Then why exactly am I paying upwards of $9 for this frozen bullshit? 

We had a real good laugh about all the upcharges for our choice of side. Tortilla chips come standard and it's extra for fries?! Cmon. I really should have known something was amiss when our server neglected to ask how we would like our burgers cooked. The bacon on my burger was undercooked and chewy, while the patty was wayyy overcooked. No pink in sight. 

Be sure to check out Farrens if you don't have any taste buds or standards for your dining experience!

I'm new to Champaign and heard a lot about Farren's. My boyfriend and I have been there many times. We love the relaxing and hipster atmosphere. The service is great -- everyone is genuinely friendly. The food is excellent. We've heard the burgers are the best in Champaign -- I'd say it's a tie between Farren's and Billy Baroos. I love their salads (although , I wouldn't recommend paying extra to add chicken.)  Overall, a great local place you should try.

Great bar for food and drinks!! Small location is the only thing making me give it 4 stars instead of 5. If they are busy you will generally have to wait a while as they do not have too much seating inside the bar. They have a great alcohol selection and great burger selection.

Be cautious of the red hair waitress!!!!! Have to say firstly, when we went there today like 11:30 am, there were nobody inside the store at all. I know it is a pub-ish place, but I brought my 1 year old daughter simply because I heard their burger could be impressive. Turned out, not at all, just normal burger with an overcharged price, that is all. And what came next is what made me determined not to visit any again. My daughter needed to get her diaper changed before we leave, and the RED HAIR WAITRESS immediately showed indifferent look on her face and impatiently assign us to their shared toilet where no place can be used to change diaper if you don't count the dirty mosaic floor. I am pretty sure if they can, they will cancel the in-store highchairs and post a "no kid allowed" sign. In conclusion, Mediocre FOOD and WORST SERVICE in Campaign area.
The Russell is a must have. I recommend getting it with a Kobe patty.

A little place tucked away in an alley? It's worth a try, right? I went here with a group of friends on a Friday night. It looked busy when we walked in but we had no problem getting a table for the 5 of us. 

I loved the variety of draft beers here and enjoyed trying out a few as well as trying sips of my friend's drinks. 

The menu had a lot of options but it looked like the star of the show was the burgers so I went with the Green Chile Burger.  I thought it might be too spicy but it ended up being not bad at all and I think it could have actually used more kick.  The fries were delicious. 

We did have a little mess-up with our order when a friends didn't get her onion rings, but as soon as we notified our server of the error, he apologized and went to put in an order for the missing rings. We also had to switch servers halfway through our meal (not sure what happened to our first guy, maybe his shift was over?), but we had no problems still getting our correct checks.

I wish this place was a "locals only" hidden gem...

The Kobe Burger with their signature in house fries is by far the best burger in town. Great salads for anyone looking to have somethings a little lighter. Hipster employees with a cool atmosphere makes this place a must stop for anyone who comes to Champaign..... lol even though i wish they wouldn't.

Ah yes, Farron's. Welcome to my service full of fail poop list. While the food here is tasty, the service leaves much to be desired. There's simply no good reason to have people wait when there party is only one short and half the tables are empty. Nope. No. Oh hell no.

So if you want a burger downtown try Big Grove, Distihl, or even Guido's (the service is only marginally better than Farron's). If you want the best burgers for your buck though try Jurassic Burger in campus town.

Word to the wise, #servicematters

The bacon cheeseburger was the best burger I've ever had. Fries and soup were also very yummy. I have had the bacon BBQ chicken sandwich and the chips. Absolutely amazing!! I will definitely be going back!

I was seated near the door so my spot was a little drafty, but my burger was huge and absolutely delicious! I also tried the homemade potato chips at the recommendation of a random fellow patron, and those were pretty good. I'd certainly come here again, but cross my fingers for a warmer seating section.

Update!  I've since not had a problem with the tea tasting old, and have had a couple of salads that were much better.

Best burgers in town, in my opinion. They're always cooked to perfection, with an appropriately proportionate bun and delicious, thick, crunchy pickles. And, if you're pretty starved, I suggest getting fries on the side. They're toasty brown and delicious, especially when doused with malt vinegar.

They also have a full bar and great apps, specials, and desserts. I sometimes just get the hummus plate app for dinner. And the fish n chips special is pretty darn good for being land locked. As for desserts, if they happen to have the chocolate chile cheesecake, DO IT.

The environment is very laid back and the restaurant is fairly dim. There are a couple of TVs, but if you don't like to be distracted, you can sit away from them.
Beware days of Illini games; they are packed to the gills at dinner time.

Finally went here after hearing how good it was. Overall, I was pleased.
I'm a firm believer that burgers can only be so good. That being said, these guys make a pretty good burger. 

I got a bacon burger with bleu cheese crumbles. The meat was cooked almost perfectly and I got a generous heap of cheese on top. I almost couldn't taste the bacon though...I would suggest they kick it up a notch.

I found it odd that the default side is tortilla chips. They are pretty average, but do have a nice seasoning and taste good with their in-house made salsa (had to ask for it, though). It was fresh-tasting and not too spicy.

Beer selection is good. They had about 5 beers on tap and a healthy list of bottles. The bottle selection was not what you typically see at a burger place, which I liked. Prices weren't too bad either.

I'd come here again, for sure. If anything, I want to try that bison burger that people have been talking about. I LOVE bison burgers, but wanted to try their more traditional burger to see what all the fuss was about. It's a nice atmosphere. Everything is right there. There's no "back"; you can see the kitchen and where all of your food is coming from. I don't feel like I'm in some underground burger basement, but a nice, low key, bar where I could go on a date or get drinks with friends. Definitely recommend giving it a try!

Many will tell you this is the best burger in town. Im not sure if I would go that far (Black Dog and Crane Alley will give it a run for its money) but it definitely wont disappoint if you're looking for a BIG, tasty piece of beef between two buns.

Location is a little out of the way as it is basically in a basement in downtown Champaign. You will miss it if you are not looking for it. 

Fries are very tasty. Service is good. Prices are a little steep for a burger. Solid place

I've been to Farren's twice - once in my freshman year, and again in my final year at the U of I.  I'm very sad that I haven't been more.  Farren's is a hidden gem with friendly staff, a lively atmosphere, and probably the best burgers in Champaign-Urbana.  I've got a weak spot for places that serve great food WITHOUT an attitude.

They have the second best burger in town, after black dog. But their burgers are great and flavorful. I can never eat fast food burgers any more. They also have a good beer selection. I like the "hole in the wall" feel since this place can be hard to find for first timers.

Almost passed on Farren's tonight with the line reaching the door thanks to the Taste of Champaign. 

Glad I stayed. 

Not only did the wait staff do a fantastic job of keeping the line moving, but the kitchen produced a fantastic burger in an expedient manner while they had a full board throughout my entire stay. 

Will definitely be coming back.

Farren's has an awesome burger. My burger had a very thick patty, bleu cheese, bacon, sautéed onions, sautéed mushrooms, lettuce, and onion. The patty was very thick and juicy, and the buns were fantastic. The burgers come with tortilla chips, but you can substitute the chips for fries or onion rings at an additional cost. The burger alone costs between $8-9, and you will be paying around $9-13 for your entire meal, depending on what extras/substitutes you get. I will definitely be coming back here again.
The space is pretty tight here, but if you avoid the lines, you'll be satisfied. Hamburgers are their specialty, with the "Russell" as their house style.

Came here on a Saturday night and the wait was not too long, only about 10 mins for a table for 2 since we had just beaten the 7pm dinner rush. We got the mozzarella sticks as an appetizer and it was not too special, pretty pricy as well ($8 for 6 mozzarella sticks). I ordered the mushroom cheeseburger and it was delicious! Very decent pricing and large portions as well. Service was good and overall I'd come here again for a casual meal.

To be honest, I was a little disappointed. I just got a basic burger (the first one on their menu with a fancy name). The food was average, neither great nor bad, but I guess I just had a higher expectation from a yelp-4-star place. The ambient was a little better for a place that's very hidden by the alley. I would rather go to Desthil next time where they have better drinks and the same quality food in the same price range.

Fantastic food, enjoyed the small resturant over big chain. Service was good as well.  It was very busy every table filled but still had drinks kept filled and food came out hot and fresh in a decent amount of time. I got the Sponoli burger it was amazing and the onion rings are homemade tasted fresh. Others at my table got the venison burger which my brother loved and the Russell burger also great reviews from all at the table.  Highly recommend this restaurant!! Waited said they were just voted one of the best burger joints in town.
Fantastic burgers and fresh cut fries. Great service. Nice little local joint. We will definitely be back.

Best veggie burger I've had in a long time, and the sauce that came with was so good my friend next to me used some on her burger as well. Very satisfied with the portion size for the price you pay. Loved how attentive the staff was and how they all come around to check on you, but not overwhelmingly so. Only critiques are that the fries were nothing special and the server did not ask for my ID when handing them my debit card (yes I'm that person that writes SEE ID). Overall very satisfied and will be returning.

I wanted to be a Farren's lover, but after several visits, I just don't get it.  It's a slightly overpriced burger with upcharged everything (chips, fries, sauce, etc..) and you have to request tomato and pickle? Give me a break. You don't have a server assigned to your table, because you can "ask any staff member for anything", not surprisingly, service is spotty. 

The "kitchen" is a flattop with a couple fryers next to the bar. It is remarkable that the cooks produce the volume that they do, however, seeing their space, there isn't any room for them to actually making anything in house, so it's probable that most items on their menu are bought frozen.

For a burger, you'll pay the same price at Big Grove for much better food and service.
Fantastic hand cut fries and gourmet burgers in downtown bar and grill atmosphere.  Worth the wait for a table. Great service.
The Burgers and hand cut fries are amazing. Also some of the friendliest staff in town. Definitely going to come back if I'm back in champaign.

I just moved my daughter into an apartment for college and stumbled on Farren's. We had a great burger and ice cold beer after a long drive and move in. I had the bacon feta blue cheese burger and it was terrific. Fries. onion rings and chips were all great. Service was very good. Thank you Farren's!

oh hey best burger i have ever had in my life. service was quick and good. we got there earlier but as we were leaving the wait was getting long. they seemed understaffed service wise. but they handled it well. get the chips not the fries.

I think one sentence sums this place up perfectly... "Greasiest Food you Will Ever Eat."

There's a lot of hype and praise about this place, but I really can't dig it just because all the food comes out dripping in grease.  It's a burger and fries type of place to begin with, but even the soups come out with heavily oiled broth and salads loaded with Oily salad dressing (definitely ask for it on the side so you can spare yourself the grease attack)

My co-workers love this place so I go every now and then, but of all the different dishes I've ordered, they were all dripping buckets of grease.  Sure it's tasty, and I will always dig some greasy food, but this is really too much... Way too much.  Burgers, fries, salmon burgers, steaks, chicken sandwiches, salad, etc.  it's all pouring oil out the wazoo.  

I got to say the service is exceptional though.  Every time I've went the service was very friendly, quick, and our food always came out fast.  Prices are reasonable too.  As for the atmosphere, I can see some people digging it but it's quite "unique" to say the least.  You really would never even be able to guess this was a restaurant looking at it from the outside.  There's a sign on the main road for it, but then you got to walk into the block a little bit and its in a plain colored building, hid away in a little nook.  It only gets more "interesting" as you go in and descend into the restaurant.  Yes, it's in a sort of a basement almost.  

I'm not against the place by any means, and the food is OK and the service is great.  It's just far too greasy for me.  It's just a place for those that don't mind really really greasy food.

I'm in the middle of another one of these week-long jaunts through the midwest and found myself in Champaign and needing lunch.  I've sampled some pretty caloric fare over the last few days, so thought I'd try something a bit lighter today for lunch.  Stopped in to this place and saw that they had a strawberry salad with chicken and a raspberry vinaigrette and got that with spinach subbed for the mixed greens.

Service was friendly and astonishingly quick.  Salad came back in probably under 3 minutes from the time I ordered it.  So that was good.  And the salad TASTED great. So why am I giving this place three stars?  Well, first, in order to get 5 stars you have to be really exemplary.  This place was very good in a lot of ways and would probably get a 4* rating from me except.... they REALLY need to work on their presentation.  

The salad shows up and it has a lot of great things going for it... spinach, strawberries, walnuts, grapes.... and then they had this huge pasty white chicken breast thrown on top in a single form and they had the garishly pink vinaigrette just poured right on top.  The salad LOOKED horrible.  I'm not sure how they cooked the chicken, but based on the way it looked, it could have been boiled because it was just this pasty, gelatinous pale breast that was completely unappetizing. And the pink dressing on top of it didn't help.

I strongly considered eating around the chicken, but brought myself to taste it and it was actually really good.  I just don't know how they cooked it to make it look so horrible.  So my suggestions for this restaurant when serving a salad that includes chicken: Throw it on the grill for a few seconds to give it some grill marks or do SOMETHING to give it some color.  And then toss the salad to mix in that pink dressing.

So good food, good service, but presentation of my dish kept this place from getting 4*

Great burgers and excellent fries. As a burger fanatic I really enjoyed the spicoli burger, patty was excellent but perhaps could have used some more of the toppings listed on the menu. The fries are amazing, thin and crispy and definitely worth the upcharge. However, for lunch on a Saturday our food took forever to come out even though the restaurant wasn't full. We were seated immediately but waited at least 45 minutes for four burgers. The burgers are head and shoulders above any other burger I've had in the CU area but that wait time was brutal. Hopefully that's not the case next time I'm here!

We heard good things about Farren's and even a rumor that they have some of the best burgers in the CU area.

Well, the rumor was certainly confirmed.

The location is a little hidden, it's kind of in an alley and the restaurant is almost like a basement. It's nothing fancy and probably doesn't want to be. We didn't have to wait to due a couple tables being open, but shortly after we were seated and as we were leaving a ~20 minute line formed.

Everyone ordered a burger and we got the homemade chips for an appetizer. These were good and a pretty large portion too. I got the Russell burger which came with bacon, mushrooms, and blue cheese. I opted for a side of fries which was an upcharge from the chips that normally come with it. The burger itself was large and very well put together. The toppings all complemented each other quite well, this was not your typical over-hyped pub burger. French fries were really tasty, too!

My only minor qualm with the place is the service. We had ~3 different servers/people who took our order, checked on us, brought our food out, etc. My beer was nowhere to be found after ordering it nearly 10 minutes ago, so I had to flag down somebody and remind them. This other server (maybe a manager?) had to re-check my ID before bringing me the beer immediately and apologizing, not a big deal! 

In the end though it was a good experience, the burgers met or exceeded expectations. I also liked how the whole menu was really straightforward, not overdone with 1000's of random items slapped together like some bar menus can be.

Strongly recommend, 4/5!
I wish their menu had a little more things to order but the burger was fantastic. Fries were definitely fresh and delicious. Even had my favorite beer ON TAP! Weihenstephaner.

A tiny little bar/restaurant in a basement basically.  It is hidden back behind Nitaya Thai restaurant and can be hard to find if you did not know what you were looking for.  A bar runs a long the back, with tables scattered.  Very limited seating, so expect to wait if you get here at peak hours.  Very cozy.  The service is usually pretty good.  They do the best they can when the place is slammed.

Six quality beers on tap, much more in bottles.  So they got the good beer covered.  Full bar as well.  The food is great.  Some of the best pub grub in town.  Of coarse the burgers are what they are known for.  Which are great.  The salads are also really good.  A great place to come for a beer and a meal.

Farren's is one of my favorite restaurants in town. It's the kind of place you begin to frequent so much, the waiters remember your exact order. I have switched it up on occasion, and every single thing I have tried was awesome. My favorites are the tacos (chicken or black bean burger that come with sour cream and great salsa) and the chicken Caesar salad (homemade croutons, and the dressing is better than any Caesar dressing I've ever had); my husband always gets either the green chile cheese burger or the Kobe burger. The hamburgers here are very thick, so make sure you're hungry! You simply cannot go wrong with anything on the menu--it's that good. 

The ambience is one of my favorite things about the place; Farren's is located under ground and has a bar, enough room for large groups of friends, and doesn't feel stuffy. In the winter it can get cold in there, so make sure you bundle up.
Them burgers is huge, boy.  And tasty!  Way better than a Royale with cheese!.  Or a Big Kahuna Burger.  I do love the taste of a good burger.

Great place for burgers, salads, casual dining.  Service has always been friendly and efficient.  Long beer list, though no Heineken.  Parking in massive city garage right next door.  Usually busy, though I've never waited long.

Pretty darn good. Make sure that you are willing to pay more for better food when you stop by, b/c this is definitely a step above pub grub. They use interesting local ingredients (lemon chive potato salad was awesome). Their beer menu is not as vast as some nearby joints, but they have a few shining stars. Right now they have a special on Krusovice, a great Czech pilsner. Service is fast and friendly at the bar. On the not-so-good side, when I visited a while ago, their selection for vegetarians was notably lacking. This has improved somewhat.

So, went here on a busy Saturday night.  Took about 30 minutes to get a table, but that's pretty expected with a place this small and popular.  

The burgers are what everybody seems to rave about, so that's what I ordered.  I ordered the "Fire Burger" (I think that's what it was called).  It's a decent size burger patty (probably like 1/3 lb or so) topped with roasted jalepenos, red peppers, and finished with some jalepeno/habenero cheese.  The waiter warned me that "if you're worried about it being too spicy, it is." 

Well, it only took about 10-15 minutes for the burger to arrive, which is pretty decent considering how busy it was. 

I'm giving the place 2 stars for a few reasons: the "Fire" burger was probably around a 2 or 3 out of 10 on (my) spicy scale.   The burger, although properly cooked and juicy (a nice medium-well), lacked seasoning and resultingly flavor. Between a lack of spiciness and lack of spices, the burger was pretty bland.  Add to that some undercooked and unseasoned fries to have a whole plate of bland. 

For burgers that cost around $9, I would expect a lot more.  I can't say its worth the wait and I definitely have no desire to go back.

If you're looking for a nifty burger place, this is the establishment you want to be at. Their Kobe burger is filled with fun flavor. The portabello mushroom dish is actually two large fried mushrooms. It can be a tad difficult to get the waiters' attention sometimes though.

I came here for my birthday in November. We came around dinner time but more towards the end, so they were able to seat my group of 7 people as soon as we got in. The waiter was super nice. Since it was my birthday, he ended up not charging me for my meal, which was kind of him.  I ordered the Russell burger, which has mushrooms, bacon, jalapeño cheese and blue cheese sauce--amazing! It was juicy and huge, and extremely tasty. We also had dessert. I enjoyed both desserts, but I enjoyed the chocolate dessert even more. Just a little forewarning, the chocolate dessert is really really sweet. High risk for getting chocolate wasted! :-)
Wow, never thought I'd think a burger is BLAND but there you have it. Zero seasoning and they overcooked both me and my wife's burger.
Had the Russell burger with onion rings.  Husband had the same burger with fries.  Food was excellent and service was fast.

WOW!!! Best burgers I've ever had. Not only is the meat quality top notch (shout out to ole time meat and deli shop) but the huge selection of cheeses is amazing as well! The fact of the matter is that I can literally have just a plain cheeseburger and it be phenomenal! But on top of that they have a great selection of different types of burgers. Try to get a side of blue cheese dressing, it's so good! Also we sat at the bar and were treated like regulars immediately. Can't wait to go back.

Shall I compare thee to a summer's day? I am honestly obsessed with farren's. The burgers are phenomenal. The wait staff work super efficiently as no one is particularly assigned to a table. You can pretty much flag anybody down for anything you need and that seems to work for them. There isn't a lot of seating so on a busy day there might be a wait, but it is always worth it. I'm a big fan of the Russell Burger which is cheese, bacon, and mushrooms. The beef just tastes great and you get a mouthful for 10 to $15. They also have a good selection of beers if that's what you're into or a cocktail depending on the ingredients (there is a bar). I can't say how much I love this place enough. I brought my grandmother, who is not apt to like any bar in particular, and she loves it so much that every time she visits she asks that we go to the "alleyway restuarant" aka farren's. There is no outdoor seating so if you're looking for ambiance you might want to go elsewhere. But if you want really good burgers at a decent price and top notch service, then come right in!

Really really solid. It's easy to miss this place, because it's tucked back off the street. The ambiance won't blow you away, but the bartenders know their stuff and are very funny, the burgers are great and the fries really make it. Plus they always have a decent and unexpected on-tap beer selection.
This is slowly becoming a favorite go-to place.

My boyfriend absolutely LOVES this place. I'm a little indifferent. This comes with a HUGE disclaimer that I don't really handle red meat well so, 80% of the menu is not an option. Last night, I had the veggie burger. I was sure to ask for all the extra fixings. Even so, they were still a little skimpy on the tomato. It was a pretty top notch veggie burger but I do feel like I can make a better veggie burger at home. I wish they had dijon mustard - only plain yellow mustard is available. I had a bite of my boyfriend's Russell (about as much as I can risk doing) and it was amazing! Boy was I jealous he can enjoy red meat this much! This is a pretty great place with tasty food, wonderful friendly service, and an awesome beer selection but, since the non-red-meat options take up such a small portion of the menu, I find myself easily bored with the menu. Beef lovers would give this place 5 stars easily.
The burgers and salads are wonderful. Definitely the best fries in town, and you can even order sweet potato fries. Great service, and cozy atmosphere.

This is probably my favorite hamburger place in town!! Their meat patty is real good! And it's so filling, can barely finish one in one sitting! Definitely worth eating out here! There is usually a line though, so I try to get there around 5 for dinner!

So, it took 18 months but I finally gave Farren's another shot. As it turns out, they weren't as happy to see me as I was to see them. Or at least, their tall waitress with the red hair had a problem with me.

We walked in and asked for a table for two. Only four tables were occupied, but she motioned for us to take a two top table right between the order workstation and a loud table of about eight. I smiled and shook my head "No" - mostly because I'd twisted an ankle and didn't want to walk across the restaurant (painful) only to ask her for another table. I also didn't want to be in what I perceived as the loudest place in the restaurant - shoved up against the wall by the grill area and wait station with the loud group on the other side. Refusing the table apparently ticked her off: she looked seriously irritated and she showed us another table closer to the door, slammed the menus down so loudly that I jumped and then stormed behind the bar whereupon she made a less than kind remark (loud enough for me to hear) about my request to another coworker. I was astounded at her attitude. She didn't bring us water or ask what we wanted to order so when she walked by again I stopped her and outright asked her if she had a problem waiting on us, I received no response - just a glower. Fortunately a pleasant young woman with long dark hair waited on us and our meal and drinks were fine, and I enjoyed them even though the tone of the evening was spoiled by the ugly behavior of big red, the waitress with the matching mood.

I live in LA and don't get to Champaign as often as I'd like, but Farren's was always a favorite. Lately though, some of the employees have spoiled it as one of my favorite places. Frankly, I'll drive to Mahomet and JT's from now on - it isn't worth the negativity to go to Farren's.

This is my favorite restaurant in Champaign!  I always get a bacon burger and it is amazing.  I have never had a burger under or over cooked.  The fries are always good.  I also love their beer menu.  I swear, nothing goes better with a bacon burger than a Scotty Karate Scotch Ale!  I have brought friends, family and girlfriend, with no complaints!  Parking is not an problem with the parking deck right next door.

Amazing burgers! Their ground beef is unreal.  It's a disservice to the burger to put ketchup on these badboys.  They cook them well-done, and still they're juicy and tasty! My favorite is the Spiccoli, it's swiss, mushroom and onions.  Fantastic!

So, the lady's sister hit a car in a parking lot somewhere. So there's a new bumper for a car being painted in her garage on Sunday. The sister comes inside the house around 5ish, as we are trying to decide where to go to dinner. Name places... all no, finally "Farrens?" and it's a yes. We decide to meet there at 6:30. 
Drive from the country into town, and exit at Neil street from 74. As we are exiting, look to the north and see Toys R Us is packed, as is Olive Garden, and most everything else that way. 
Drive down Neil, turn onto Main, and all the restaurants in downtown are relatively empty: 301, Dublin, Big Grove, Guidos, Destihl... everything is relatively vacant. I start to feel sad, not for the empty restaurants, but for the people who decided that it was worth it to eat at Olive Garden. I felt genuinely sorry for people who thought that Olive Garden was a good decision. 
We park, and walk to Farrens. We go past more restaurants that have seats available, Miga, that Thai place... and still I'm thinking... FRIGGIN OLIVE GARDEN IS FULL!!!
We go down the ramp into Farrens. I make eye contact with the server He points to a table. No one else sees him point to the table. I go and sit down, they stand on the ramp, and are like "You can't just go sit down, they have to seat you". and i'm like... DO YOU KNOW WHO I AM!!! A little while later, I inform them that yes, he did tell us to sit there. 
We place our drink order, there's Triptych on tap, so that's nice. (Seems to be a recurring theme, that Triptych stuff is everywhere). I order a beer on draft, the lady orders a beer on draft. The sister asks "do you only have that craft stuff on draft?" She gets, I think, a Coors Light. How can you drink mass produced beer with craft food? 
Kridz orders the mozzarella sticks. I get the portabella mushroom appetizer. The moz sticks are moz sticks. Nothing too fancy (it seems) about them. The portabella mushroom is the entire cap, cut in half, breaded and fried, served on a salad bed. Hell, this thing is practically a meal to itself. For the actual meal, I order the Russell, you can't go wrong with sautéed mushrooms, bacon, blue cheese sauce and pepperjack cheese. BACON ON EVERYTHING!!! 
At some point before the burgers came out, we also ordered the mac and cheese. If this is on the menu, get it. The ladies at the table were like.. "what is this puddle on the top? grease?" and i'm like "uh... that's butter". Then they are like "who puts butter in their mac an cheese?" then go into a discussion of how they made their mac and cheese for holidays... this, this, this, butter, this, this... seemingly forgetting that they put in a whole lot of butter. Butter makes everything better, as does bacon. mmm bacon butter. 
I dive into my burger, I also got fries with that, fries are delicious, but unnecessary after eating some of the mac and cheese and the whole mushroom cap. I finish my burger. I have blue cheese sauce throughout my mustache and beard. Thus is the struggle I deal with. A drippy delicious burger, all throughout the beard. 
I have another beer. Everyone else finishes eating. The ladies sit around and wait for the sisters significant other to show up because... she locked her keys in her car when she parked. They wait, she will meet me momentarily..."where are you going?"

Farren's took a couple of times for me to warm up to.  Hidden by a parking garage, it's a bit lacking in curb appeal, but their burgers are GREAT.  If I'm not grilling, this is where I will have a burger.  And their tuna tacos -- yum . . . . the special is totally worth your money, it's a huge meal! 

The beers are usually around $5 for drafts, not cheap but in line with other Downtown restaurants. 

Don't bother with the tortilla chips, they're almost always stale. Get the fries. You know  you want them anyway. 

The tables are crappy, the ambiance not so chic.  But they make a fiiiine  burger.

Great burger!!!  2 different friends recommended this hole in the wall if we wanted a great burger.  Farren's did not disappoint!! I had the "Russell."  It was wonderful with the bacon and sautéed shrooms with the blue cheese sauce. My wife had a the standard bacon cheeseburger with American. Plus, surprisingly the sausage, potato and kale soup hit the spot on a cool day.  It was very flavorful and just the right amount of peppery!

Delicious burgers!

Glad I finally got to try this place. The burger didn't disappoint. The only con may have been the waitress...she wasn't as fast in taking our orders and our checks, but it was also a busy day. 

Got the spicoli. Bacon, mushrooms, onions and cheese. Need I say more? It was so flavorful! The burger was perfectly cooked too (generous amount...). I was so full. Got the fries (you pay extra for these). Oh and a little suggestion--it was a bit misleading but we were told that you can order a half salad instead of the chips (so bizarre to me that they offer chips with burgers). However, note that you pay for the half salad so it's not a true substitution. This was not very clearly stated by waitress and a few people were disappointed to have to pay $4 or so extra for the side salad. 

The fries were good too. Aside from those issues, the burgers are tasty and I'd come back again!

very chill place to grab a burger and drinks with friends.
The burgers are probably the best in the CU area and it's cheap. 
they have specials but they ran out of the fish and chips
I got the Fire burger and my friend got the Russell which were recommended by the waitor. 
the fire burger was very spicy which is good! 
the fries were amazing! the kind that's almost brown with a bit of skin on it. 
also got a beer there (O'fallen) it's a bottle but it was really sweet which is what I asked for.

Yup, I'm a fan. Solid burger, always cooked appropriately and always delicious. The truffle chips are good, usually a few under-cooked ones that slip by. Not the greatest burger I've ever had and I'm not holding them up to that standard.

Mostly I'm motivated to write a review because the negative reviews here are hilarious. If you want a well done burger then go to burger king and stop crying about your overly meaty sandwich. If you want a fancy restaurant get the F out of a corn field. Servers are people too and sometimes aren't perfectly attentive or perfectly cheery when you are a giant pain in their ass. After-all this is a bar, in a basement, in a college town. They make good burgers.

Great burger, with great fries (unfortunately extra -- the tortilla chips it comes with by default are good, but seriously it seems like a cop-out). The waiters were knowledgeable and friendly, but not overbearing. The vibe is, as people say, dark but cool, and it is very difficult to spot if you don't already know where it is.

One weird moment -- the first time we ever went to Farren's, my gf asked the waiter for a beer recommendation and received a "Wheach" -- a Peach Wheat. This was a very good selection, as it combines two of her favorite things: fruit-flavored beer and puns. The next time we went back, she asked for the Wheach -- and the waiter had no idea what we were talking about. Not "we're out" or "it's no longer in season" or "we no longer carry that" -- he had never heard of it. All of the beer we've gotten there since has been solid, but we never saw the Wheach again....

Been to this hidden pub and burger place a few times and it's pretty good. Quick to seat us and plenty of different food options available. Prices aren't too much and I enjoyed the food I had there with my partner. Unfortunately, the service here always tends to be subpar at best. One server just disappeared on us halfway through serving. Good food with okay service, worth a visit though!

Easily the best burgers in CU. I have eaten here more times than I can remember.  I would honestly pay double for the burger and still be happy. Great small hidden gem of downtown champaign with parking all around.

This has been a staple in our family's lives for the last 5 years, birthday parties, holiday parties, business meetings and countless family get togethers.  Caroline and her staff are the best!  I have never felt more comfortable and welcome in any restaurant!  The food is consistently amazing and the specials are always outstanding.  Fine food, great pub environment-family favorites include, hummus plate, wings, burgers (include specialty burgers)  chips and fish tacos and of course ice cold Krushevich on tap!!!!

I would take off another half a star.. because I realized after I left that they never asked me how I wanted my burger done. I came here a few years back, and I think they changed their menu a bit. My party went for their burgers, and it still tasted as good as before. The bun was warmed nicely, and the burger tasted pretty juicy. However, since they kept the veggies on the side (lettuce, tomato, pickles, onions) I would have expected larger pieces instead of shredded lettuce so it would stay in the burger easier. The green chili wasn't all too noticeable, but added a nice chill to it. Friend also mentioned the fire burger had a nice spice level to it. Chips were eh, for the relatively inexpensive price, they charged extra for fries. Fries were ok, but a bit too salty imo. Would come here again- definitely seems better suited for smaller parties.

The kobe beef burger was probably the best burger I've EVER had. It was so tender and juicy. I'm not even a huge burger fan but I could go for this one anytime. Even my dad, who could eat a burger for every meal agreed with me here. It's the best burger in CU and regularly wins awards for it.

Really, everything I've tried there is very delicious and the food comes out fast and the service is super nice. Carolyn and her crew are so great and you're like family when you get in there. 

And unlike "Nifty C." I actually really liked that you can see the guys cooking in the kitchen. Yes, it's a little dim in there, but I just think the setting makes the atmosphere a bit more casual and intimate.

If you're downtown for a casual meal, look no further than Farren's!

I love the burgers.  The staff is always hella attentive and even when it's packed the line moves quickly.  The ambiance is also set up so that the customers are relaxed enough to engage with one another (if you choose, too).  If you are looking for a place where no one knows your name and has a good burger, this is the place.

Food: Amazing, as always. I got the Russell and the blue cheese sauce was delicious but on the saltier side. For people who do not like blue cheese it does not taste like blue cheese at all!

Substituted the chips for fries and the $1.50 was worth it. Portion size was big. 

The Strawberry chicken salad was good too but did not have a lot of strawberries...hefty amount of chicken 

Service: Great! Always checked up on the table. 

Place: Small cozy pub

Just been here 2 or 3 times but I probably won't be going back.  

I find the layout irritating: it feels like a cramped and poorly ventilated basement cafeteria.  

Waiting a long time for service seems typical and on my last trip my friends and I waited about 10 minutes just to be recognized (I actually had to 

flag down someone by waving and shouting) then another 15+ to be seated. They could at the very least greet their customers and let them know the 

wait time.  There were people behind us who were seated before us because they had fewer people in their group, but looking around, they could have 

easily seated our group of 5 by moving some tables together (which they ended up doing anyways). Even after we were seated it took forever to get 

something to drink (even after ordering drinks it took over 10 minutes). 

Since you don't actually have an assigned server, you can be assured that many of the things you ask for will be forgotten by whomever brings your 

food, whenver they get around to bringing it.

Nothing particularly good to say about the food.  It was fine, I guess, but why is it so expensive?

Location: kinda lousy, service: kinda lousy, food: kinda meh.  Why bother?

I like Farren's pretty well for a happy hour type dinner.  The grilled steak salad and sweet potato fries are my favorites.  

I've had super super annoying service more than once (not BAD as much as way too interested in starting a conversation and becoming friends with the diners), and every single time my friend has ever asked the kitchen to hold the french fries he has gotten an extra huge heaping load of french fries.

Man, were the truffle fries overhyped!! The waiter made it sound like a piece of heaven sprinkled with ocean salt, when in reality it's just chips. Other than the truffle disappointment, the burger was pretty good. Can't complain too much about a burger joint... it is what it is.
